entries.title: US appeals court upholds Florida transgender toilet policy
entries.description: LGBTQ groups say transgender people face growing threats of violence and discrimination in the US.

entries.title: US President Biden issues pardons for drug crimes, murder
entries.description: The six year-end pardons signal shifting attitudes towards domestic violence and drug policy in the United States.

entries.title: Jair Bolsonaro leaves Brazil for Florida, avoiding Lula handover
entries.description: The far-right leader gave a farewell to supporters on Friday before departing for the US, where his plans are unclear.

entries.title: Photos: Network of fixers preys on migrants crossing into Mexico
entries.description: The result is a booming business that often targets a population of migrants who are largely poor and desperate.

entries.title: Bolivian judge places opposition leader in pre-trial detention
entries.description: Members of the conservative opposition have accused the government of silencing dissent as tensions continue to rise.

entries.title: What are the final revelations from the January 6 investigation?
entries.description: US House committee has conducted more than 1,000 interviews about January 6 attack and former President Donald Trump.

entries.title: Peru: A Divided Country
entries.description: As Peru is thrown into a political crisis, these women dream of opposite futures for the country.

entries.title: What did 2022 mean for the US labour movement?
entries.description: While unionisation rates remain low, workers have shown a growing interest in collective bargaining at major companies.

entries.title: What are the intentions of Israel’s new cabinet?
entries.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is back in power with the most hardline government in the country's history.

entries.title: India release of Pakistani film The Legend of Maula Jatt stalled
entries.description: Despite getting approval from India’s censorship board, the screening of The Legend of Maula Jatt has been postponed.

entries.title: Photos: A year of facing nature’s fury
entries.description: A cascade of extreme weather exacerbated by climate change devastated communities across the globe this year.

entries.title: Brazil declares three days of mourning for Pele
entries.description: The football legend, who is deemed the greatest player of the 20th century, died in Sao Paolo on Thursday.

entries.title: Eritrean soldiers leaving parts of Ethiopia’s Tigray – witnesses
entries.description: Eritrean withdrawals from two main towns in Tigray follow a truce signed by regional rebels and Ethiopia's government.

entries.title: Analysts predict economic struggles for Zimbabwe in 2023
entries.description: Ahead of the 2023 polls, there are concerns that Zimbabwe's economic woes could spill over.

entries.title: Russia denounces criticism of Nagorno-Karabakh peacekeepers
entries.description: Armenia has accused Russian forces deployed along the blockaded Lachin corridor of failing to fulfil their duties.

entries.title: Kosovo opens all border crossings as Serbs remove roadblocks
entries.description: Ethnic tensions along Kosovo’s eastern border appear to be easing amid fears of an armed conflict.

entries.title: The beauty and beasts in Jerusalem
entries.description: Israel's attack on Shireen Abu Akleh's funeral haunted me the most in 2022.

entries.title: US House committee releases Trump tax returns after long fight
entries.description: Donald Trump opposes the public release of his tax returns and fought in court for nearly four years to prevent it.

entries.title: It is time to address anti-Roma racism in the US
entries.description: The recent Senate resolution celebrating Romani culture and heritage is a good start, but our work is far from over.

entries.title: China names US Ambassador Qin Gang as new foreign minister
entries.description: New ambassador replaces Wang Yi, who has been China's top diplomat for the past decade.

entries.title: Israeli land registration threatens Palestinian mass expulsion
entries.description: Palestinians fear a continuing Israeli plan to resolve property ownership claims will evict them from their homes.

entries.title: WHO says China COVID travel restrictions ‘understandable’
entries.description: Many countries are imposing restrictions on travellers from China because of a surge in infections.

entries.title: In 2022, India came for Kashmir’s land, votes and journalists
entries.description: Experts and residents fear that new policies are disenfranchising and disempowering the Muslim-majority population.

entries.title: South Africa mourns tanker blast victims, death toll rises to 34
entries.description: The number of deaths due to the gas tanker explosion has tripled since the incident happened on Christmas Eve.

entries.title: Five ways the US Supreme Court reshaped policy in 2022
entries.description: The court's new conservative majority issued rulings over the past year on abortion, gun rights, religion and more.

entries.title: Putin to Xi: Russia seeks to strengthen military ties with China
entries.description: The Russian leader says he is expecting the Chinese president to make a state visit to Moscow in 2023.

entries.title: Spain imposes new COVID restrictions on arrivals from China
entries.description: Visitors from China will be required to test negative for COVID-19 or prove they have been fully vaccinated.

entries.title: Palestinians watch on as far-right Israeli govt comes into power
entries.description: While some Palestinians see the new government as no different from previous ones, others are worried.

entries.title: Ryanair cabin crews strike in Belgium, dozens of flights grounded
entries.description: Cabin crews launch a three-day strike over the New Year holiday over pay, in some cases below Belgium's legal minimum.

entries.title: Israel charges two soldiers for revenge attack on Palestinians
entries.description: Israeli soldiers very seldom face prosecution and conviction for crimes committed against Palestinians.

entries.title: Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant wounded in car crash
entries.description: Pant is in a stable condition after his car collided with a divider and caught fire, according to police.

entries.title: ‘A tough little sparrow’: How a ring helped me grieve my mother
entries.description: 'I closed my eyes to connect with my mom and the first thing I saw was a sparrow.'

entries.title: Photos: World mourns Pele, the king of football
entries.description: The Brazilian played football barefoot as a child and rose to become a virtuoso universally regarded as one of the best.

entries.title: Nearly 1,700 journalists killed over past 20 years: RSF
entries.description: A Reporters Without Borders report says the last two decades have been 'especially deadly' for journalists.

entries.title: Mediators meet to bolster Ethiopia truce as Tigray conflict dims
entries.description: The mediators are meeting amid slow implementation of the truce and as aid workers say Eritrean troops remain.

entries.title: Attack in eastern Syria kills 10 oil workers: state media
entries.description: The SANA news agency said that the attack targeted buses transporting workers in Deir Az Zor.

entries.title: Russian diplomat, Indian politician spar over oligarch’s death
entries.description: Indian police are investigating the death of sausage magnate Pavel Antov over the Christmas weekend.

entries.title: For China’s travel-starved masses, wanderlust calls
entries.description: Travel bookings in China have soared since Beijing announced it will reopen the borders from January 8.

entries.title: Myanmar court finds Aung San Suu Kyi guilty, adds 7 years in jail
entries.description: Following a series of politically motivated prosecutions, Aung San Suu Kyi now must serve a total of 33 years in jail.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 310
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters day 310, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: China fighter jet flew within six metres of US surveillance plane
entries.description: Video of incident shows a Chinese J-11 jet flying dangerously close to a US surveillance plane over the South China Sea.

entries.title: Indonesia to tighten palm oil exports from January 1
entries.description: Exporters will be allowed to ship six times their domestic sales volume, less than the current ratio of eight times.

entries.title: Russia’s Putin welcomes Netanyahu back to power in Israel
entries.description: Putin calls for 'strengthening Russian-Israeli cooperation in all areas' in message to Netanyahu as new Israeli PM.

entries.title: Vivienne Westwood, ‘queen of punk’ fashion, dies at 81
entries.description: 'She was always trying to reinvent fashion,' said Andrew Bolton, a curator at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.

entries.title: Latest drone attack on Kyiv sends residents to air raid shelters
entries.description: Ukraine’s military said 10 drones were shot down during an early morning attack on Friday, local media reported.

entries.title: COVID vaccine hesitancy leads to child health concerns in PNG
entries.description: Distrust of COVID-19 vaccine in Papua New Guinea linked to reduction in children receiving more general vaccinations.

entries.title: South Korea to test travellers from China amid COVID surge
entries.description: The move comes after similar announcements by India, Italy, Taiwan and the US.

entries.title: Influencer Andrew Tate detained amid human trafficking probe
entries.description: Controversial British-American internet personality had been questioned by Romanian authorities in April.

entries.title: Bolivian opposition leader held on ‘terrorism’ charges
entries.description: Prosecutors seek six-month pre-trial detention for jailed right-wing Santa Cruz Governor Luis Fernando Camacho.
